title: How to Download Games Onto a Graphing Calculator

steps.headline: Download and install TI-Connect.
steps.description:
TI-Connect is the software you use to transfer programs to Texas Instruments graphing calculators. You can download TI-Connect from https://education.ti.com/en/products/computer-software/ti-connect-sw.  Use the following steps to download and install TI-Connect:
Click Download. Click the download link for the language and operating system you use. Double-click the install file in your web browser or "Downloads" folder. Follow the on-screen instructions to install TI-Connect.

steps.headline: Download MirageOS (TI-83 Plus and TI-84 Plus only).
steps.description: MirageOS is an operating system that plays games on your calculator. You can download it at https://www.ticalc.org/archives/files/fileinfo/139/13949.html. Click Download to download the MirageOS program in a zip file.

steps.headline: Download the game you wish to transfer to your calculator.
steps.description:
You can use Google or your favorite search engine to search for games for your calculator model (i.e. search "TI-84 Plus Games"). Make sure the games you download are compatible with your calculator model. You can download games in Basic or Assembly language. Some websites you can download games at are the following:
http://tiwizard.com/games-for-ti-83-plus-and-ti-84-plus/
https://www.ticalc.org/pub/

steps.headline: Connect your calculator to your PC.
steps.description: Use the USB cable that came with your calculator. Most TI graphing calculators use a USB silver cable. TI-84 Plus and TI-83 Plus models using a USB A to USB mini-B cable. You might be asked to install a new hardware device. If so, Insert the CD that came with your calculator in you CD/DVD-rom and follow the on-screen instructions.

steps.headline: Open the TI Connect application.
steps.description: It has a blue and yellow icon with two arrows. Click the icon in the Windows Start menu or the Applications folder on Mac.

steps.headline: Click TI DeviceExplorer.
steps.description: It's the first option in TI Connect. It has an icon that resembles two calculators and a magnifying glass. This displays the software on your calculator in a separate windows. Make sure your graphing calculator is turned on. Allow a few minutes to connect to your calculator. If it doesn't connect the first time. You may need to disconnect the cable and reconnect it.

steps.headline: Install the MirageOS file (TI-83 Plus and TI-84 Plus only).
steps.description: Use the following steps to install MirageOS on your TI-83 Plus or TI-84. Extract the MirageOS.zip file using WinRAR, WinZip, or 7-Zip. Right-click the MIRAGEOS.8xk file. Click Send to TI-83/84

steps.headline: Open the zip file for the game you downloaded.
steps.description: Use an archive program, such as WinRAR, WinZip, or 7-Zip to open the zip file containing the game file you downloaded.

steps.headline: Open the Readme file or instructions file.
steps.description: Many games and programs contain a text file with installation instructions. These instructions tell you which file to transfer to your calculator.

steps.headline: Right-click the file you need to transfer to your calculator.
steps.description: The file you need to transfer is listed in the Readme or instruction file that came inside the zip file for the game you downloaded.

steps.headline: Disconnect your calculator from the computer and close Ti connect.
steps.description: After the transfer is complete, disconnect the USB cable from your calculator.

steps.headline: Press the APPS button on your calculator.
steps.description: This displays a list of programs installed on your calculator.

steps.headline: Select a game.
steps.description: This opens the game on your graphing calculator. If you are using MirageOS on a TI-83/84 select MirageOS, in the apps menu. Then select the game you want to play.

tyn: A firewire-to-USB cable (comes with the calculator)
The CD that comes with your calculator
A computer with at least one available USB port
text:
Download and install TI-Connect. TI-Connect is the software you use to transfer programs to Texas Instruments graphing calculators. You can download TI-Connect from https://education.ti.com/en/products/computer-software/ti-connect-sw.  Use the following steps to download and install TI-Connect:
Click Download. Click the download link for the language and operating system you use. Double-click the install file in your web browser or "Downloads" folder. Follow the on-screen instructions to install TI-Connect. Download MirageOS (TI-83 Plus and TI-84 Plus only). MirageOS is an operating system that plays games on your calculator. You can download it at https://www.ticalc.org/archives/files/fileinfo/139/13949.html. Click Download to download the MirageOS program in a zip file. Download the game you wish to transfer to your calculator. You can use Google or your favorite search engine to search for games for your calculator model (i.e. search "TI-84 Plus Games"). Make sure the games you download are compatible with your calculator model. You can download games in Basic or Assembly language. Some websites you can download games at are the following:
http://tiwizard.com/games-for-ti-83-plus-and-ti-84-plus/
https://www.ticalc.org/pub/ Connect your calculator to your PC. Use the USB cable that came with your calculator. Most TI graphing calculators use a USB silver cable. TI-84 Plus and TI-83 Plus models using a USB A to USB mini-B cable. You might be asked to install a new hardware device. If so, Insert the CD that came with your calculator in you CD/DVD-rom and follow the on-screen instructions. Open the TI Connect application. It has a blue and yellow icon with two arrows. Click the icon in the Windows Start menu or the Applications folder on Mac. Click TI DeviceExplorer. It's the first option in TI Connect. It has an icon that resembles two calculators and a magnifying glass. This displays the software on your calculator in a separate windows. Make sure your graphing calculator is turned on. Allow a few minutes to connect to your calculator. If it doesn't connect the first time. You may need to disconnect the cable and reconnect it. Install the MirageOS file (TI-83 Plus and TI-84 Plus only). Use the following steps to install MirageOS on your TI-83 Plus or TI-84. Extract the MirageOS.zip file using WinRAR, WinZip, or 7-Zip. Right-click the MIRAGEOS.8xk file. Click Send to TI-83/84 Open the zip file for the game you downloaded. Use an archive program, such as WinRAR, WinZip, or 7-Zip to open the zip file containing the game file you downloaded. Open the Readme file or instructions file. Many games and programs contain a text file with installation instructions. These instructions tell you which file to transfer to your calculator. Right-click the file you need to transfer to your calculator. The file you need to transfer is listed in the Readme or instruction file that came inside the zip file for the game you downloaded. Disconnect your calculator from the computer and close Ti connect. After the transfer is complete, disconnect the USB cable from your calculator. Press the APPS button on your calculator. This displays a list of programs installed on your calculator. Select a game. This opens the game on your graphing calculator. If you are using MirageOS on a TI-83/84 select MirageOS, in the apps menu. Then select the game you want to play.
sentences: Download and install TI-Connect.
TI-Connect is the software you use to transfer programs to Texas Instruments graphing calculators.

You can download TI-Connect from https://education.ti.com/en/products/computer-software/ti-connect-sw.  Use the following steps to download and install TI-Connect:
Click Download.
Click the download link for the language and operating system you use.
Double-click the install file in your web browser or "Downloads" folder.
Follow the on-screen instructions to install TI-Connect.
Download MirageOS (TI-83 Plus and TI-84 Plus only).
MirageOS is an operating system that plays games on your calculator.
You can download it at https://www.ticalc.org/archives/files/fileinfo/139/13949.html.
Click Download to download the MirageOS program in a zip file.
Download the game you wish to transfer to your calculator.
You can use Google or your favorite search engine to search for games for your calculator model (i.e.
search "TI-84 Plus Games").
Make sure the games you download are compatible with your calculator model.
You can download games in Basic or Assembly language.

Some websites you can download games at are the following:
http://tiwizard.com/games-for-ti-83-plus-and-ti-84-plus/
https://www.ticalc.org/pub/ Connect your calculator to your PC.
Use the USB cable that came with your calculator.
Most TI graphing calculators use a USB silver cable.
TI-84 Plus and TI-83 Plus models using a USB A to USB mini-B cable.
You might be asked to install a new hardware device.
If so, Insert the CD that came with your calculator in you CD/DVD-rom and follow the on-screen instructions.
Open the TI Connect application.
It has a blue and yellow icon with two arrows.
Click the icon in the Windows Start menu or the Applications folder on Mac.
Click TI DeviceExplorer.
It's the first option in TI Connect.
It has an icon that resembles two calculators and a magnifying glass.
This displays the software on your calculator in a separate windows.
Make sure your graphing calculator is turned on.
Allow a few minutes to connect to your calculator.
If it doesn't connect the first time.
You may need to disconnect the cable and reconnect it.
Install the MirageOS file (TI-83 Plus and TI-84 Plus only).
Use the following steps to install MirageOS on your TI-83 Plus or TI-84.
Extract the MirageOS.zip file using WinRAR, WinZip, or 7-Zip.
Right-click the MIRAGEOS.8xk file.
Click Send to TI-83/84 Open the zip file for the game you downloaded.
Use an archive program, such as WinRAR, WinZip, or 7-Zip to open the zip file containing the game file you downloaded.
Open the Readme file or instructions file.
Many games and programs contain a text file with installation instructions.
These instructions tell you which file to transfer to your calculator.
Right-click the file you need to transfer to your calculator.
The file you need to transfer is listed in the Readme or instruction file that came inside the zip file for the game you downloaded.
Disconnect your calculator from the computer and close Ti connect.
After the transfer is complete, disconnect the USB cable from your calculator.
Press the APPS button on your calculator.
This displays a list of programs installed on your calculator.
Select a game.
This opens the game on your graphing calculator.
If you are using MirageOS on a TI-83/84 select MirageOS, in the apps menu.
Then select the game you want to play.
